call out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The firemen called out to him.
call out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to ask or order a person or an organization to help, especially in a difficult or dangerous situation
call out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The army was called out to help fight fires.
call out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to order workers to go on strike
call out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The transport workers were called out.
call out.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a situation in which someone is called to another person’s house or place of business to do repairs, help them etc
call out.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The lifeboat has had ten call-outs in the past year.
